title: Amanda Holden says Scarlett Moffatt 'has done the right thing' by splitting up with her boyfriend
text:
Amanda Holden says Scarlett Moffatt 'has done the right thing' by splitting up with her boyfriend The star has praised the Gogglebox legend for being single as her fame continues to soar Share Amanda Holden believes Scarlett Moffatt was right to split up with her boyfriend Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Amanda Holden believes Scarlett Moffatt was right to split from her boyfriend as it allows her to focus on her career. 
The Britain’s Got Talent judge waded in to give her opinion on young love’s saddest tale, after Scarlett and boyfriend Luke Crodden ended things earlier this month. 
“I think she has done the right thing - she’s hot property right now, so needs to be by herself,” she told Fabulous magazine . 
Scarlett split from Luke, her boyfriend of a year, reportedly because the reality star was so busy with new work. Scarlett and her Luke Crodden split earlier this month after one year together (Photo: Instagram/scarlett_moffatt) Amanda thinks the split was for the best (Photo: Barcroft Media) Scarlett Moffatt at the National Television Awards, where her dad was her red carpet date (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
After being crowned Queen Of The Jungle at the end of 2016, Scarlett’s been inundated with job offers, including joining and Dec for the new series of Saturday Night Takeaway and front a revamped version of the dating show Streetmate. 
And Amanda has urged Scarlett’s new screen mates Ant and Dec to take her under their wing. 
“I can’t wait to see her in her new told on Saturday night takeaway with Ant and Dec,” she continued. “You look after her, boys!” 
Despite the split, Scarlett hopes she’ll remain friends with Luke. Scarlett out for dinner with Ant, Dec and Stephen Mulhern (Photo: Instagram/scarlett_moffatt) 
“It’s a positive thing that Scarlett’s schedule is so busy at the moment as it will take her mind off the split,” an insider told The Sun earlier this month. 
Scarlett decided against posing with Luke on the red carpet when she stepped up to co-host the National Television Awards in London in January. 
Instead of inviting her boyfriend to join her in front of the cameras, she took her dad. 
Ahead of the ceremony in London, Scarlett revealed who she was taking to the annual event, as she tweeted: "Got my date for the red carpet, my bestie, my dad." Aww. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
